author: The Associated Press
description: Pearl Jam drummer Matt Cameron said Monday that he's leaving the band after nearly 30 years
title: Pearl Jam drummer Matt Cameron to leave band after nearly 30 years

description: At least 104 people are dead after catastrophic flooding ravaged central Texas on July 4. A century-old Christian camp for girls, Camp Mystic, confirmed 27 of its campers and counselors are among the dead and missing. NBC News’ Tom Llamas reports on the lives lost and remarkable stories of survival.
title: Death toll rises to at least 104 in catastrophic Texas flooding

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visits the White House and joins President Trump for a dinner.
title: Netanyahu meets with Trump at White House

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: Search crews scour West Texas for signs of life after devastating floods.
title: Search crews scour West Texas for signs of life after devastating floods

author: Kevin Collier
description: Conservative internet and media personalities are criticizing Attorney General Pam Bondi and the Trump administration after a recent memo on Jeffrey Epstein.
title: DOJ memo dismissing Epstein conspiracy theories sparks anger from conservatives

author: Sahil Kapur
description: As Democrats mount a full-court press accusing Republicans of slashing Medicaid to pay for tax cuts for the rich, the GOP will attempt to shift focus to other provisions.
title: Republicans plot a strategy to fend off Democratic onslaught against Trump megabill

author: Francesca Gariano
description: Naomi Osaka took to social media to address a now-viral clip of her postgame interview after her Wimbledon loss
title: Naomi Osaka reacts to viral clip of her harsh comments about her Wimbledon defeat

author: The Politics Desk
description: Elon Musk has vowed to create the “America Party,” which he says will “fight the Republican/Democrat Uniparty” and be serious about reducing the national debt.
title: The potential impact of Elon Musk's third-party threat: From the Politics Desk

author: Becca Wood, TODAY
description: In a race between Joey Chestnut and Usain Bolt, who could eat a hot dog then run a 100-meter dash faster
title: Joey Chestnut versus Usain Bolt? Debate over who would win challenge goes viral

author: Chrissy Callahan, TODAY
description: “Bachelor in Paradise” is returning for Season 10 after a two-year hiatus, giving familiar members of the “Bachelor” franchise another chance at love
title: 'Bachelor in Paradise' returns with season 10. What to know.

author: Tim Stelloh
description: The Army veteran accused of killing his three daughters in Washington state and disappearing into the wilderness for weeks may have been spotted in an Idaho forest, federal authorities said
title: Fugitive dad accused of killing 3 daughters may have been seen in Idaho

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: No. 1 Janik Sinner advanced to the Wimbledon quarterfinals Monday after his opponent, Grigor Dimitrov, retired injured while leading their fourth-round match two sets to love
title: No. 1 Jannik Sinner advances to Wimbledon quarterfinals after injury to Grigor Dimitrov

author: Angela Yang
description: 'Love Island USA' contestant Cierra Ortega is exiting the show after social media posts containing a racial slur resurfaced on social media, sparking online backlash.
title: Cierra Ortega exits 'Love Island USA' amid backlash over posts containing a racial slur

author: Erika Edwards
description: Several major medical organizations are suing Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. over removing a recommendation for pregnant women and children to get a Covid shot.
title: RFK Jr. sued by pediatricians, other medical groups over Covid vaccines

author: Melissa Chan
description: See maps and photos as Texas flooding leaves some communities with major damage. Camp Mystic all-girls camp is among the sites heavily impacted by the flash floods.
title: A muddy camp shirt and waterlogged dormitory: Texas flood in photos and charts

author: Chloe Melas
description: Nicole Daedone, who’s in jail awaiting her sentencing for crimes related to her OneTaste business, condemned the outcome of the Sean “Diddy” Combs case.
title: Convicted 'orgasmic meditation' leader rips outcome in Sean Combs trial as double standard

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: Here's what we know so far on the Texas flash floods, including where the flooding is happening, when storms could end and what could happen next.
title: Texas flash flooding: What we know, where it's happening, when storms could end

author: Alicia Victoria Lozano
description: Sprinter Jasper Philipsen, of Alpecin-Deceuninck, crashed out of the Tour de France Monday just two days after taking the yellow jersey for the first time in his career.
title: Tour de France sprint favorite Jasper Philipsen out of race after crashing on stage three

author: Ali McCadden, CNBC
description: Canadian citizen Robert Sharp was planning to visit Provincetown, Massachusetts — one of the most LGBTQ+-friendly places in America — for his friend’s milestone birthday in July
title: Some international LGBTQ+ travelers pull back on U.S. trips: 'Why would I go there?'

author: Daniela Hernandez
description: Following storms and floods that turned deadly over the holiday weekend, flood warnings remained in effect across central Texas on Monday
title: Flood risks continue to batter Texas as extreme weather rattles much of the U.S.

description: Luke and Irene Brake survived the Texas floods. They told NBC News' Zinhle Essamuah their story of escape and how they are still searching for Luke's parents.
title: Couple was 'awoken to people screaming' as Texas flood impacted their area

author: The Associated Press
description: Novak Djokovic overcame an uncharacteristically unsteady start to avoid what would have been his earliest exit at Wimbledon since 2016.
title: Novak Djokovic overcomes a poor start to beat Alex de Minaur, reach Wimbledon quarterfinals

author: Hayley Cuccinello, CNBC
description: For investment firms of the ultra-wealthy, deal-making is heating up
title: Family offices ramp up deal-making in June with bets on biotech

author: The Associated Press
description: FRANKFURT, Germany (AP) — The European Union expects to find out on Monday whether President Donald Trump will impose punishing tariffs on America’s largest trade partner in a move economists have warned would have repercussions for companies and consumers on both sides of the Atlantic
title: U.S. tariffs on European goods threaten to shake up the world's largest trade relationship

author: Sarah Whitten, CNBC
description: Lights out and away we go.“F1: The Movie” hasn’t even reached the checkered flag of its theatrical run, but it’s already Apple’s best film release ever
title: 'F1' is Apple's highest-grossing theatrical film ever

author: Reuters
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 7 (Reuters) — Developing nations participating in the BRICS summit on Monday brushed away an accusation from U.S.
title: BRICS nations resist 'anti-American' label after Trump tariff threat

author: Morgan Chesky
description: Growing up near the Guadalupe River in Kerrville, Texas, could sometimes feel like living near a volcano
title: Texas flood in my hometown is a once-in-a-lifetime tragedy

author: Rob Wile
description: The trade war chaos that engulfed the early months of President Donald Trump’s second term looked set to return Monday as he threatened two major U.S. trading partners with higher duties ahead of a key negotiating deadline.
title: White House sends letters threatening 25% import duties on Japan, South Korea goods as tariff chaos reignites

author: David Cox
description: From capsules, gummies and other edibles, to oils and lotions, CBD products have become increasingly popular in the United States.
title: Even low doses of CBD may cause harm to the liver in some people, FDA study finds

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: A person was killed after exchanging gunfire with U.S.
title: Individual killed after exchanging gunfire with border patrol agents in Texas

description: Sen. Ted Cruz spoke at the Kerr County officials briefing on the catastrophic floods in central Texas. Cruz expressed shock and dismay over the devastating aftermath caused by the flooding.
title: Cruz: Texas floods have 'broken the heart of our state'

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: The soldier reportedly recalled several instances in which civilians in Gaza were shot on the orders of Israeli commanders.
title: Israeli troops arbitrarily opened fire on Gaza's civilians, soldier tells Sky News

description: A Texas RV park owner recalled how floodwaters overtook the site, sweeping away dozens of trailers in the dark of night. WOAI's Jordan Elder spoke with Lorena Guillen of Blue Oaks RV Park, who said there is an urgent need for assistance in recovering people trapped in piled-up vehicles.
title: 'The screaming was unbearable': RV park owner tells how flash flooding overtook campers

author: Reuters
description: The U.N. Human Rights Council voted on Monday to renew the mandate of an LGBTQ rights expert, a move welcomed by advocates amid the absence of the United States, a former key supporter that is now rolling back such protections.
title: U.N. council votes to keep researching anti-LGBTQ abuses despite U.S. U-turn

description: Amazon is set to kick off their annual Prime Day, extending the sale from 2 days to 4 this year as competitors like Target, Best Buy and Walmart offer weeklong sales on tech, home, back-to-school supplies and furniture. The summer savings could be an opportunity for shoppers to get ahead on holiday purchases as tariffs threaten price increases. NBC’s Brian Cheung reports for TODAY.
title: Retailers Roll Out Big Summer Sales as Tariffs Threaten Prices

description: TODAY’s Jenna Bush Hager, whose mom, former first lady Laura Bush, worked at Camp Mystic, opens up about the community there that was struck by the devastating floods in her home state of Texas and shares memories of camp director Dick Eastland who died protecting campers.
title: Jenna Bush Hager Reflects on Camp Mystic Flooding Tragedy

description: For nearly a century, Camp Mystic has been a safe haven for young girls who spent summers there forging friendships that last a lifetime but early Friday morning, the idyllic retreat was ravaged by torrential rain and raging floodwaters. Heroic counselors and staff members jumped to action including the camp’s director Dick Eastland who died while trying to save girls from the rising waters, several of whom are still missing. TODAY’s Savannah Guthrie reports.
title: Inside Look at Camp Mystic Community Hit by Texas Floods

description: Texas flood survivors Doug Fuller and his wife Libby Evans-Fuller join TODAY to describe their harrowing ordeal as floodwaters filled their home and swept them out and what it was like having to cling to a post for hours to stay alive.
title: Texas Flood Survivors Describe Being Swept Out From Home

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu touched down in Washington ahead of a meeting with President Donald Trump about a ceasefire deal in Gaza.
title: Trump to meet with Netayahu at the White House as Israel and Hamas discuss ceasefire

description: The devastating floods in Texas have claimed more than 80 lives and a desperate search and rescue mission is ongoing where despite threats of even more rain, emergency crews are working around the clock to find 10 young campers among dozens still unaccounted for. NBC’s Morgan Chesky reports for TODAY.
title: Death Toll From Texas Floods Tops 80 as Search Efforts Intensify

author: Amina Kilpatrick
description: The National Weather Service is warning more flash floods could hit central Texas.
title: More flash floods forecasted to hit Texas and immigration enforcement in Puerto Rico: Morning Rundown

author: The Associated Press
description: DOYLESTOWN, Pa. — A Pennsylvania man accused of killing his father and posting video of his severed head online — and calling for others to help him try to overthrow the U.S. government — is set to stand trial Monday in the Philadelphia suburbs
title: Pennsylvania man accused of beheading father and posting gory video to stand trial

author: Maya Huter
description: This summer’s big sales events could offer some of the best bargains before the ongoing trade war threatens to scramble fall and winter shopping
title: Summer sales could offer the last pre-tariff bargains on many goods this year

author: The Associated Press
description: King Charles III led commemorations Monday on the 20th anniversary of the 2005 London transit bombings, the deadliest attack on the British capital since World War II.
title: King Charles leads 20th-anniversary commemoration of 7/7 London bombings

author: The Associated Press
description: Indonesia's rumbling Mount Lewotobi Laki Laki erupted Monday, sending a column of volcanic materials as high as 18 kilometers (11 miles) into the sky and depositing ash on villages.
title: Indonesia’s Mount Lewotobi Laki Laki erupted, sending ash 11 miles high

author: The Associated Press
description: Israel's military launched airstrikes early Monday targeting ports and facilities held by Yemen's Houthi rebels, with the rebels responding with missile fire targeting Israel
title: Israel targets Yemen's Houthis with airstrikes after missile launched by rebel group

description: Volunteers gathered in Hunt, Texas, to search for the bodies of an elderly couple who were missing after catastrophic flooding swept through central Texas. Ilda Mendoza said she and other volunteers discovered the body of the husband while the search continues for his wife.
title: ‘It’s never ending’: Volunteers search for elderly couple after Texas floods

author: Reuters
description: An Australian woman on Monday was convicted of murdering three elderly relatives of her estranged husband with a meal laced with poisonous mushrooms, in a case that has gripped the country.
title: Australian woman convicted on all counts in mushroom murders case

author: The Associated Press
description: Mexico beat the United States 2-1 on Sunday night for its record 10th CONCACAF Gold Cup title, with Edson Álvarez scoring a tiebreaking goal in the 77th minute after a video review reversed an offside call.
title: Mexico beats U.S. 2-1 to win 10th Gold Cup title

author: Evan Bush
description: Fatal floods in Texas that left thousands scrambling for safety with little warning have sparked a fresh round of scrutiny on Trump administration cuts to the National Weather Service
title: National Weather Service defends its flood warnings amid fresh scrutiny of Trump staff cuts
